<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// When there is external, uninstrumented code writing to memory, the shadow</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// memory can get out of sync with the application memory. Enabling this flag</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// emits consistency checks for loads to catch this situation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// When everything is instrumented, this is not strictly necessary because any</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// load should have a corresponding store, but can help debug cases when the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// framework did a bad job at tracking shadow memory modifications by failing on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// load rather than store.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// TODO: provide a way to resume computations from the FT value when the load</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is inconsistent. This ensures that further computations are not polluted.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// LLVM may store constant floats as bitcasted ints.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// It&#39;s not really necessary to shadow such stores,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// if the shadow value is unknown the framework will re-extend it on load</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// anyway. Moreover, because of size collisions (e.g. bf16 vs f16) it is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// impossible to determine the floating-point type based on the size.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// However, for debugging purposes it can be useful to model such stores.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127" lineLink="#ac63bbf6a012bb9fbca1a6ad93de6c135"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cl/opt">cl::opt&lt;bool&gt;</a> <a href="#ac63bbf6a012bb9fbca1a6ad93de6c135">ClPropagateNonFTConstStoresAsFT</a>(</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;For debugging purposes only&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/cl/#a68075925a54790e71ca790e1d4f21a40a263ac008d8d31f13ce460395fc4cf7e6">cl::Hidden</a>);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The following values must be kept in sync with the runtime.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138" lineLink="#aa205f978477e17b9978a3518f23e4110"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">constexpr</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#aa205f978477e17b9978a3518f23e4110">kShadowScale</a> = 2;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="500"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;FunctionCallee&gt;</a> Funcs;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NumSizedFuncs;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-numericalstabilitysanitizer-cpp-/nsanmemopfn/#a85787eb1162b7d741f8f3b29601e7860"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-numericalstabilitysanitizer-cpp-/nsanmemopfn/#a85787eb1162b7d741f8f3b29601e7860">NsanMemOpFn::NsanMemOpFn</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &amp;M, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;StringRef&gt;</a> Sized,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"><span class="doxyHighlight">                         <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Fallback, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NumArgs) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="506"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext">LLVMContext</a> &amp;Ctx = M.getContext();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="507"><span class="doxyHighlight">  AttributeList Attr;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="508"><span class="doxyHighlight">  Attr = Attr.addFnAttribute(Ctx, Attribute::NoUnwind);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;PtrTy = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointertype/#af8a1dbdbfd89aa4899b3c0d39495d0dd">PointerType::getUnqual</a>(Ctx);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="510"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;VoidTy = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type/#a6e20e76960d952de088354cbcd14c3ab">Type::getVoidTy</a>(Ctx);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="511"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/integertype">IntegerType</a> &#42;IntptrTy = M.getDataLayout().getIntPtrType(Ctx);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="512"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functiontype">FunctionType</a> &#42;SizedFnTy = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><span class="doxyHighlight">  NumSizedFuncs = Sized.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref/#a85ffb6531d4cda988ea81f18d4e56fb7">size</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// First entry is fallback function</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="517"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (NumArgs == 3) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Funcs.push&#95;back(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="519"><span class="doxyHighlight">        M.getOrInsertFunction(Fallback, Attr, VoidTy, PtrTy, PtrTy, IntptrTy));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><span class="doxyHighlight">    SizedFnTy = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functiontype/#af8be7844c269f201ebcee1e15048c378">FunctionType::get</a>(VoidTy, &#123;PtrTy, PtrTy&#125;, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="521"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (NumArgs == 2) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="522"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Funcs.push&#95;back(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"><span class="doxyHighlight">        M.getOrInsertFunction(Fallback, Attr, VoidTy, PtrTy, IntptrTy));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"><span class="doxyHighlight">    SizedFnTy = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functiontype/#af8be7844c269f201ebcee1e15048c378">FunctionType::get</a>(VoidTy, &#123;PtrTy&#125;, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="525"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="526"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/errorhandling-h/#ace243f5c25697a1107cce46626b3dc94">llvm&#95;unreachable</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Unexpected value of sized functions arguments&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> i = 0; i &lt; NumSizedFuncs; ++i)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Funcs.push&#95;back(M.getOrInsertFunction(Sized&#91;i&#93;, SizedFnTy, Attr));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="532"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-numericalstabilitysanitizer-cpp-/nsanmemopfn/#a79f46f68b1352b4d6948f62171edf85b"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functioncallee">FunctionCallee</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-numericalstabilitysanitizer-cpp-/nsanmemopfn/#a79f46f68b1352b4d6948f62171edf85b">NsanMemOpFn::getFunctionFor</a>(uint64&#95;t MemOpSize)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="534"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Now &#96;getFunctionFor&#96; operates on &#96;Funcs&#96; of size 4 (at least) and the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="535"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// following code assumes that the number of functions in &#96;Func&#96; is sufficient</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="536"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(NumSizedFuncs &gt;= 3 &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Unexpected number of sized functions&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1199"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1200"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// When truncating:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1201"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - (A) If the source has a shadow, we truncate from the shadow, else we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1202"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    truncate from the original source.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1203"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - (B) If the shadow of the source is larger than the shadow of the dest,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1204"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    we still need a truncate. Else, the shadow of the source is the same</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1205"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    type as the shadow of the dest (because mappings are non-decreasing), so</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1206"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   we don&#39;t need to emit a truncate.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1207"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Examples,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1208"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   with a mapping of &#123;f32-&gt;f64;f64-&gt;f80;f80-&gt;f128&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1209"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     fptrunc double   %1 to float     -&gt;  fptrunc x86&#95;fp80 s(%1) to double</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1210"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     fptrunc x86&#95;fp80 %1 to float     -&gt;  fptrunc fp128    s(%1) to double</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1211"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     fptrunc fp128    %1 to float     -&gt;  fptrunc fp128    %1    to double</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1217"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     fptrunc x86&#95;fp80 %1 to float     -&gt;  fptrunc fp128    s(%1) to double</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1278"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sched/#ab8d854a5ce2331586bcc6830cca52f0fac13545a6345c7d5b3c9cc8932ad3b0e9">Source</a> = ExtendedSourceTy ? <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/msgpack/#afdae9da66bac09f4b2bfc0fd9f0559e6a46f3ea056caa3126b91f3f70beea068c">Map</a>.getShadow(OrigSource) : OrigSource;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1279"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a88ee8e4eea43084bd8964682683da88caa1fa27779242b4902f7ae3bdd5c6d508">Type</a> &#42;SourceTy = ExtendedSourceTy ? <Link id="l01280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1280"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See (B) above.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1281"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (SourceTy == ExtendedVT)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1282"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sched/#ab8d854a5ce2331586bcc6830cca52f0fac13545a6345c7d5b3c9cc8932ad3b0e9">Source</a>;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1752"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Creates a shadow value for an instruction that defines a value of FT type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1753"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FT operands that do not already have shadow values are created recursively.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1755"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// shadows.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01778" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1778"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1830"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   - Writes of FT-sized constants. LLVM likes to do float stores as bitcasted</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2036"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetlibraryinfo">TargetLibraryInfo</a> &amp;TLI) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2038"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>.isDeclaration())</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2041"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is required to prevent instrumenting call to &#95;&#95;nsan&#95;init from within</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2042"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the module constructor.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2043"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>.getName() == <a href="#ac61faf4cee6a9bffaa4a95d2641a448d">kNsanModuleCtorName</a>)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2044"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2045"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;Instruction &#42;, 8&gt;</a> AllLoadsAndStores;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2046"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;Instruction &#42;, 8&gt;</a> LocalLoadsAndStores;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2047"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2048"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The instrumentation maintains:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2049"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - for each IR value &#96;v&#96; of floating-point (or vector floating-point) type</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2050"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    FT, a shadow IR value &#96;s(v)&#96; with twice the precision 2FT (e.g.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2051"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    double for float and f128 for double).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2052"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - A shadow memory, which stores &#96;s(v)&#96; for any &#96;v&#96; that has been stored,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2053"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    along with a shadow memory tag, which stores whether the value in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2054"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    corresponding shadow memory is valid. Note that this might be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2055"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    incorrect if a non-instrumented function stores to memory, or if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2056"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    memory is stored to through a char pointer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2057"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - A shadow stack, which holds &#96;s(v)&#96; for any floating-point argument &#96;v&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2058"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    of a call to an instrumented function. This allows</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2059"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    instrumented functions to retrieve the shadow values for their</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2060"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    arguments.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2061"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    Because instrumented functions can be called from non-instrumented</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2062"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    functions, the stack needs to include a tag so that the instrumented</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2063"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    function knows whether shadow values are available for their</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2064"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    parameters (i.e. whether is was called by an instrumented function).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2065"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    When shadow arguments are not available, they have to be recreated by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2066"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    extending the precision of the non-shadow arguments to the non-shadow</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2067"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    value. Non-instrumented functions do not modify (or even know about) the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2068"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    shadow stack. The shadow stack pointer is &#95;&#95;nsan&#95;shadow&#95;args. The shadow</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2069"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    stack tag is &#95;&#95;nsan&#95;shadow&#95;args&#95;tag. The tag is any unique identifier</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2070"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    for the function (we use the address of the function). Both variables</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2071"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    are thread local.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2072"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    Example:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2073"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     calls                             shadow stack tag      shadow stack</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2074"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     =======================================================================</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2075"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     non&#95;instrumented&#95;1()              0                     0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2076"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//             |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2077"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//             v</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2078"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     instrumented&#95;2(float a)           0                     0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2079"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//             |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2080"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//             v</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2081"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     instrumented&#95;3(float b, double c) &amp;instrumented&#95;3       s(b),s(c)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2082"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//             |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2083"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//             v</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2084"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     instrumented&#95;4(float d)           &amp;instrumented&#95;4       s(d)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2085"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//             |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2086"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//             v</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2087"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     non&#95;instrumented&#95;5(float e)       &amp;non&#95;instrumented&#95;5   s(e)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2088"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//             |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2089"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//             v</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2090"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     instrumented&#95;6(float f)           &amp;non&#95;instrumented&#95;5   s(e)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2091"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2092"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   On entry, instrumented&#95;2 checks whether the tag corresponds to its</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2093"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   function ptr.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2094"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   Note that functions reset the tag to 0 after reading shadow parameters.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2095"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   This ensures that the function does not erroneously read invalid data if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2096"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   called twice in the same stack, once from an instrumented function and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2097"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   once from an uninstrumented one. For example, in the following example,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2098"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   resetting the tag in (A) ensures that (B) does not reuse the same the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2099"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   shadow arguments (which would be incorrect).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2100"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//      instrumented&#95;1(float a)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2101"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//             |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2102"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//             v</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2103"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//      instrumented&#95;2(float b)  (A)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2104"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//             |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2105"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//             v</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2106"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//      non&#95;instrumented&#95;3()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2107"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//             |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2108"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//             v</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2109"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//      instrumented&#95;2(float b)  (B)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2110"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2111"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - A shadow return slot. Any function that returns a floating-point value</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2112"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    places a shadow return value in &#95;&#95;nsan&#95;shadow&#95;ret&#95;val. Again, because</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2113"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    we might be calling non-instrumented functions, this value is guarded</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2114"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    by &#95;&#95;nsan&#95;shadow&#95;ret&#95;tag marker indicating which instrumented function</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2115"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    placed the value in &#95;&#95;nsan&#95;shadow&#95;ret&#95;val, so that the caller can check</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2116"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    that this corresponds to the callee. Both variables are thread local.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2117"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2118"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    For example, in the following example, the instrumentation in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2119"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    &#96;instrumented&#95;1&#96; rejects the shadow return value from &#96;instrumented&#95;3&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2120"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    because is is not tagged as expected (&#96;&amp;instrumented&#95;3&#96; instead of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2121"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    &#96;non&#95;instrumented&#95;2&#96;):</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2122"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2123"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//        instrumented&#95;1()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2124"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//            |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2125"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//            v</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2126"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//        float non&#95;instrumented&#95;2()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2127"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//            |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2128"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//            v</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2129"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//        float instrumented&#95;3()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2130"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2131"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Calls of known math functions (sin, cos, exp, ...) are duplicated to call</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2132"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// their overload on the shadow type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2133"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2134"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Collect all instructions before processing, as creating shadow values</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2135"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// creates new instructions inside the function.</span></CodeLine>
